physical_appearance:This is a letter. There is an inscription in red ink at the top of the letter. The letter is printed in black ink on a plain sheet of paper. The address and date is printed on the top-right corner of the letter. The letter is signed at the bottom-right corner. There are several tears and folds on the document
 especially on the bottom-right corner.
subject_terms_1:world wars prisoners of war documents (object genre) prisons (institutions)
subject_terms_2:World War
 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Letters Prisons
subject_terms_3:war personalities Letters
subject_terms_4:
sgcool_label_text:Loose papers from the James Steele
 P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing
 Japanese banana money
 map of camp
 administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment
 list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

metadata.title_text: Miscellaneous scraps of paper from P.O.W James Steele Archives (30 pieces) P.O.W. James Steele Archives: Letter on Prison Office Furniture
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a letter. There is an inscription in red ink at the top of the letter. The letter is printed in black ink on a plain sheet of paper. The address and date is printed on the top-right corner of the letter. The letter is signed at the bottom-right corner. There are several tears and folds on the document, especially on the bottom-right corner.
metadata.subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war documents (object genre) prisons (institutions)
metadata.subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Letters Prisons
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Loose papers from the James Steele, P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing, Japanese banana money, map of camp, administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment, list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
